topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5502452463687269a6370200#post_5502452463687269a6370200
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55024479636872150e9d2c00#post_55024479636872150e9d2c00
Hence the whole "We're both being stubborn assholes" bit from earlier.[/bq]
How about this?

If boku no hero academia gets a anime it's going to be super popular and chances are daily life with monster girl will be popular as well cause they both have a large enough follower base to ensure that both will do well viewer wise.

Side note: I think everyone here can agree that boku no hero academia will get a anime, but chances are they're just waiting till the manga gets further in to start the anime so it doesn't have to resort to filler.  I  know you want a boku no hero academia anime, but chances are the creators are going right now "we should wait a couple chapters to start on the anime cause filler episodes would not work well with the story since the manga is story heavy".  In say 6-12 months the manga will be far enough in that they can start the anime without having to resort to filler.
